title: How to Fix Account Not Found on TikTok: Causes, Tips & More

steps.title: You may have been blocked.
steps.content: You may have been blocked. TikTok, like many other social media platforms, lets you block people and prevent them from viewing your profile or contacting you. If someone has blocked you and you search for their profile, you'll see "Account Not Found."

steps.title: The account is private.
steps.content: The account is private. Users can choose to make their account public or private. They could also hide certain things from other users, so it's possible the account is hidden for everyone.

steps.title: The account you're looking for no longer exists.
steps.content: The account you're looking for no longer exists. If the username is no longer in use, you'll see "Account Not Found." The person you're looking for may have deleted their TikTok account or changed their username. If the name you're searching for doesn't match an existing account, you'll see the "Account Not Found" error.

steps.title: The username was reset by TikTok.
steps.content: The username was reset by TikTok. TikTok has a 180-day Inactive Account Policy. To prevent people from creating accounts with the intention of only taking a name, TikTok will reset custom usernames to a generic name after 180 days of inactivity. [1] X Research source If you're searching for a username that hasn't been active in a long time, you'll see "Account Not Found" if the username hasn't been reclaimed.

steps.title: The account you're looking for was banned.
steps.content: The account you're looking for was banned. TikTok bans accounts that don't follow the community guidelines. If the account you're looking for posted videos that violated the guidelines and continued uploading similar content after being warned, their account may have been banned from the platform.

steps.title: App glitches or server errors.
steps.content: App glitches or server errors. If you're sure the user exists and you're not blocked, something could be wrong with TikTok. If there's an issue with TikTok's servers, you may also experience trouble with liking or commenting on videos .

steps.title: Your internet connection is spotty.
steps.content: Your internet connection is spotty. You can't use the TikTok app without the internet. If you have a poor Wi-Fi or data connection, you'll most likely be unable to search for users and instead get the "Account Not Found" error.

steps.title: Check if you're blocked.
steps.content: Check if you're blocked. To know if you've been blocked, try searching for the same username using a different TikTok account (or asking a friend to check). If the person's profile shows up from another account, you'll know you are blocked . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check if the account was banned.
steps.content: Check if the account was banned. If you're the owner of the account, you might be able to recover it if you didn't violate community guidelines.

steps.title: Make sure the server isn't down.
steps.content: Make sure the server isn't down. The best way to tell if the servers aren't functioning properly is by visiting a tracker website like DownDetector . If you see a lot of recent user reports, it's likely that there's an issue on TikTok's end.

steps.title: Clear your app cache.
steps.content: Clear your app cache. If you have an Android, you can do this within your settings. If you have an iPhone or iPad, you'll need to delete the app and install it again.

steps.title: Check your internet connection.
steps.content: Check your internet connection. If you have an unstable internet connection, it may prevent the app from working properly. Troubleshoot your internet if necessary. If you're trying to use TikTok using cellular data, try switching to a Wi-Fi network instead. You can also test your internet speed in your mobile web browser.

steps.title: Why am I seeing "Account Not Found" on TikTok?
steps.content: Why am I seeing "Account Not Found" on TikTok? If you see Account Not Found , this means you're unable to see the current TikTok account.

steps.title: How can I tell if I'm blocked on TikTok?
steps.content: How can I tell if I'm blocked on TikTok? Try searching for the person you think blocked you. If you can't find their account and know they haven't deactivated it, you're blocked.

steps.title: What does "Account Not Found" mean on TikTok?
steps.content: What does "Account Not Found" mean on TikTok? Account Not Found on TikTok means you may be blocked by the user, the user may have deleted their account, or even internet issues.

steps.title: Why am I blocked on TikTok?
steps.content: Why am I blocked on TikTok? If you're blocked on TikTok, you may have posted content that wasn't appropriate to the user. It doesn't have to be personal; it is usually a way for users to curate their own For You page and feed.

steps.title: How do I fix "Account Not Found" on TikTok?
steps.content: How do I fix "Account Not Found" on TikTok? To fix Account Not Found , try searching for the user on a different account. Check your internet settings and try reinstalling the TikTok app.

steps.title: Can I restore a deleted account on TikTok?
steps.content: Can I restore a deleted account on TikTok? If you deleted your TikTok account, it is deleted permanently. You can only restore a deactivated account by logging back into your account. [3] X Research source
